intro: Tetragonanthus schiedeanus, commonly known as the Schiedea tetragonantha, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, four-angled stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value.
